title: 3 Easy Ways to Update Your Yahoo Sign-in Settings

steps.title: Navigate to the Yahoo website in your web browser.
steps.content: Navigate to the Yahoo website in your web browser. You can use Google Chrome , Safari, Mozilla Firefox , or another browser. [1] X Research source If needed you can create a new Yahoo mail account . To use 2-step verification, you'll need two verified recovery options on your account.

steps.title: Click Sign in.
steps.content: Click Sign in . This will be next to the search bar.

steps.title: Enter your login information and click Log in.
steps.content: Enter your login information and click Log in .

steps.title: Hover over your icon.
steps.content: Hover over your icon. This will be in the top-right, next to the search bar.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . Settings will be next to a cog icon. By default, you'll see your Personal Info page.

steps.title: On the left panel, click Account Security.
steps.content: On the left panel, click Account Security . This will open a new page. This is also where you can change your Yahoo password .

steps.title: Click Turn on 2SV.
steps.content: Click Turn on 2SV . This will be underneath This is how you sign in now and Password . A new window will open.

steps.title: Click Get started.
steps.content: Click Get started .

steps.title: Select your 2-step verification method.
steps.content: Select your 2-step verification method. You can choose Phone number , Authenticator App , or Security Key . Phone number: You will receive a code via text to confirm your identity. Authenticator App: You'll need to enter a code generated by an authenticator app to confirm your identity. Security key: This is a physical authentication device that can be used to verify your identity via Bluetooth or by plugging it directly into your device.

steps.title: Add two recovery methods.
steps.content: Add two recovery methods. If you don't already have two verified recovery methods on your account, you'll receive a pop-up window to add a recovery method. You may be prompted to enter the phone number you used to sign up for your account. Enter a valid recovery email and a new phone number. Click Add .

steps.title: Enable 2-step verification.
steps.content: Enable 2-step verification. You'll be asked to verify your identity with the provided code. This will be sent in the method you chose previously. Once verified, click Continue , then Done . You'll be taken back to the Account Security page. 2-Step Verification will say ON .

steps.title: Navigate to the Yahoo website in your web browser.
steps.content: Navigate to the Yahoo website in your web browser. You can use Google Chrome, Safari, Mozilla Firefox, or another browser. You can use this method to generate a password for third-party apps that require passwords to sign in.

steps.title: Click Sign in.
steps.content: Click Sign in . This will be next to the search bar.

steps.title: Enter your login information and click Log in.
steps.content: Enter your login information and click Log in .

steps.title: Hover over your icon.
steps.content: Hover over your icon. This will be in the top-right, next to the search bar.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . Settings will be next to a cog icon. By default, you'll see your Personal Info page.

steps.title: On the left panel, click Account Security.
steps.content: On the left panel, click Account Security . This will open a new page.

steps.title: Click Generate app password.
steps.content: Click Generate app password . This will be underneath Other ways to sign in and App Password .

steps.title: Click Get started.
steps.content: Click Get started . A new window will open.

steps.title: Enter the app name and click Generate password.
steps.content: Enter the app name and click Generate password . Use the field to input the app name. You may be asked to login again to confirm your identity. Yahoo will generate a new app password.

steps.title: Use the app password.
steps.content: Use the app password. Return to the app's login screen. Copy the app password and paste it into the password field.

steps.title: Navigate to the Yahoo website in your web browser.
steps.content: Navigate to the Yahoo website in your web browser. You can use Google Chrome, Safari, Mozilla Firefox, or another browser. [2] X Research source If needed you can create a new Yahoo mail account .

steps.title: Click Sign in.
steps.content: Click Sign in . This will be next to the search bar. If you're already logged in, you must log out first.

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . This will be next to your email address and your name. If you don't see this option, your login information may be auto-filled by your browser. You can turn off autocomplete on Chrome , remove website data from Safari, or delete autofill data on iOS . If you use another browser, you can find these options in your browser's settings.

steps.title: Click Remove from this device.
steps.content: Click Remove from this device . Yahoo will remove your login information. You'll need to enter your login manually next time you sign in.
